channel.title: Kemu Tech Blog
channel.description: Kemu's Tech Note about Angular / Django / etc...

item.title: [M1 Mac] A story about npm install failing with chromium error and how to deal with it.
item.description: M1 I got a chromium error when I did npm install on my Mac, so a note on how to handle that.

item.title: Python Typehint new / deprecated
item.description: Some items have been added or deprecated without being noticed. Since there are many deprecated items, only the most frequently used items are listed.

item.title: Linking AWS CodePipeline and GitHub to push images to ECR
item.description: We used GitHub's OAuth authentication to link with AWS CodePipeline and performed Auto Push to ECR using triggered CodeBuild, and we will show you how to do it.

item.title: GitHub Actions (1)
item.description: This section introduces how to automatically cancel the previous job when multiple pushes are performed and how to write information in the Job Summary.

item.title: GraphQL graphene-django n+1 problem to be addressed
item.description: If GraphQL queries are simply implemented, the n+1 problem will occur when the front side writes references to other models. This section describes how to deal with this problem.

item.title: Python offline translation argostranslate
item.description: We have been using argostranslate for offline translation of our blog in multiple languages, and we would like to share how we did it.

item.title: IOS Safari 15.4 released, try new CSS elements svh, lvh, dvh
item.description: The URL bar height issue that has plagued the iPhone seems to have been resolved, so check out the new elements.

item.title: Perform Angular Sentry error tracking.
item.description: We have done error tracking for Angular Application and automatic source map upload and release creation with GitHub Actions, and we will show you how to do it.

item.title: Try Angular + Scully Server Side Generate
item.description: I have done Server Side Generate with Angular + Scully and will share how to do it.

item.title: Real-time rendering of mermaid.js
item.description: There were multiple times when we wanted to use graph diagrams using mermaid.js, so we put together a real-time drawing method and created a tool to perform real-time drawing.

item.title: Try Django 4.1 Async View, Async ORM
item.description: Django 4.1alpha1 was released and we checked the new features & operation.

item.title: Deploy SPA to GitHub Pages with SEO in mind
item.description: We will also explain what you need to pay attention to from an SEO perspective when deploying SPAs to services on GitHub Pages, Cloudflare Pages, and how to do Angular deployments.

item.title: Perform virus scanning in MacOS Clamav
item.description: I don't want to keep Clamav resident, but I would like to do a full scan periodically to ensure safety, so I'll show you how to do it.

item.title: Cloudflare Pages Display pages only to authenticated users
item.description: If you host a static site on GitHub Pages and do not maintain a backend, you cannot authenticate users, so deploy the site on Cloudflare Pages and use Cloudflare Access to authenticate users and allow them to view the site only after they pass.

item.title: Pyodide Run Python scripts from JavaScript
item.description: I went with the flow after the presentation on PyScript at PyCon US 2022 and introduced Pyodide, which I have touched at hand for now.

item.title: Creating MacOS Windows Installation Media
item.description: I had a chance to make windows 10 boot media on my M1 Mac, so I will show you how to make it.

item.title: Creating RSS / Checking the operation of Chrome Web Feeder
item.description: The RSS Feeder function returned to Chrome 94~ on Android before we knew it, so we created RSS feeds, distributed them, and tested how they looked.

item.title: Using Django JWT Authentication
item.description: Django Rest Framework, note on the SimpleJWT library operation checks. Token creation -> Token validation -> Token re-issue process -> Checking how to access pages that require login using tokens.

item.title: Generate Graphene Django Graphql documentation
item.description: The project using Grapnene-Django outputs a Graphql schema, checks the information output, and automatically generates documentation from the output schema. The generated documents are deployed from CI to GitHub Pages.

item.title: Creating a Django project from a custom template
item.description: I have created a template repository of Django configurations that I use all the time and I'd like to show you how to use it. It is configured by default with flake8, mypy, black, isort, and CI to perform static checks of the code and run tests.

item.title: Create a health care application with GitHub Actions and GitHub Pages
item.description: We have combined GitHub Actions and GitHub Pages to create a user input field to display daily health data in a graph, and we will show you how to do this and how to implement it.

item.title: Visualizing OpenApi Documents
item.description: It introduces the differences between Swagger, Redoc, and the method of automatically documenting with CI based on OpenApi files output from REST API and publishing them on GitHub Pages. It also provides a viewer for documentation generated from OpenApi files.

item.title: Manage Tab key behavior inside textarea tags
item.description: This section introduces a type-based writing method for managing the behavior of the Tab key inside the text area, which is a common use case when creating applications, because it was found on other sites that the method of holding on to the Any type was used.

item.title: Use Pillow Japanese font
item.description: We will show you how to implement Pillow's Japanese fonts, which tend to be dependent on the host OS font, in a way that does not require font downloads in other environments/runners.

item.title: Handling GitHub Flavored Markdown with marked.js and highlight.js
item.description: The official name of Markdown handled on GitHub is called GitHub Flavored Markdown, which is a self-explanatory notation that extends the default Markdown. This time, we will apply GitHub css of highlight.js to convert Markdown text to HTML.

item.title: Automatic type generation from OpenApi documentation
item.description: Generate types from previously generated OpenApi documents. [Previous] Use [@openapitools/openapi-generator-cli] to generate types. zsh $ npx @openapitools/openapi-generator-cli genera

item.title: GitHub Actions summary of frequently used settings
item.description: Running Tests at Arbitrary Timings If tests are fired in both push and pull requests in all cases, tests with the same contents will be fired twice on the pull request. Therefore, the test will fire twice on the pull request when the pull request is created, when the pull request is updated, and when the test is merged (ma

item.title: JSON Typer is released.
item.description: We have added a function that allows TypeScript types to be automatically generated by loading JSON data. The type is generated by inputting JSON data as shown in the example below. The problem is escaping list types and JSON keys, but I think it is easy to use when you want to generate types easily. [U

item.title: IP Address Checker is released.
item.description: We have released a function that allows you to check the IP addresses of browsing users. Please be assured that we do not collect IP addresses, but only keep a record of previous visits in local storage. The internal configuration is as follows <img width="555" alt="Screenshot 2022

item.title: Getting along with AWS Apex Domain
item.description: If your site is located on AWS, a common configuration is to place an SSL certificate on the load balancer and specify EC2 as the target group. In this configuration, a CNAME record is usually added to the DNS record for the domain, and the DNS name of the load balancer. <img width

item.title: Use Angular reCAPTCHA
item.description: You can use reCAPTCHA to prevent access from bots. Normally, when using reCAPTCHA, a script tag must be placed in the HTML. However, since the script tag in index.html is escaped and erased, you can use [ng-recaptcha] to remove it.

item.title: About the structure of the site
item.description: Old site [kemu.site] <img width="834" alt="screenshot 2022-03-20 13 11 44" src="https://user- s.githubusercontent.com/29157528/159147797-67a49372-2bf

item.title: Angular State Management @ngneat/elf
item.description: [We recommend checking it out üöÄ üöÄ. ---Elf, a newer state management solution, has been published.

item.title: Angular Frequently written code/library repository
item.description: library - [@ngneat/reactive-forms] - type safe with formGroup - store form inputs in session storage and save/load when reloaded etc - [@datorama/akita] - state management la

item.title: Place script tags within Angular component
item.description: If a script tag is placed outside of src/index.html, it will be automatically removed. Reference: [angular/angular 4903] So, for example, if you place a button that can be retrieved by [Twitter Publish], the css for the tweet button will not be hit.

item.title: Wake up Django Rest Framework OpenAPI documentation
item.description: I had a chance to generate OpenAPI documentation from the API, so I took note of it.

item.title: Using Google Adsense with Angular
item.description: In a normal SSR, it is possible to distribute and monetize advertisements simply by placing an automatic ad script for Google Adsense in the <head></head>. However, in the case of SPA, if only automatic ads are used, reloading does not occur due to page transitions, so only fixed ads at the bottom of the page will be served.

item.title: Display OGP in SPA deployed with GitHub Pages (spirited)
item.description: Normally, when an SPA is deployed, the OGP is not displayed on twitter and other sites. This is due to the fact that the bot that acquires the OGP does not execute the js, and because it is an SPA, there is no static HTML file for the corresponding link. Therefore, we usually use lambda, etc. to display the page for the bot, and then use

item.title: Blogging with GitHub Action and Pages
item.description: Environment - npm v8.3.1 - node: v16.14.0 - Angular: v13.2.5 - @ng-bootstrap/ng-bootstrap: 12.0.0 * npm run ng add @ng-bootstrap/ng-bootstrap fails

item.title: Doing well with cache in Nuxt
item.description: Automatically checks if the current code is up-to-date and updates the cache. Validation Environment - Nuxt: 2.15.8 - @nuxtjs/pwa: 3.3.5 Code nuxt.config.js js { plugins: ['plugi

item.title: Using Gmail API push notification
item.description: You will be able to hook into the email and interleave the process. Environment - Python 3.10 - google-api-python-client==2.36.0 - google_auth_oauthlib=0.4.6 - google-cloud-pubsub==2.9.0

item.title: Writing front-end tests (snapshot test section)
item.description: Environment Angular 13, node 16 Remove Karma which is included by default since we will use jest sh npm run ng add @briebug/jest-schematic Reference: https://github.com/brie

item.title: Limit the number of DRF-linked models displayed
item.description: In django, there is a feature called prefetch_related that can be used to suppress the SQL issued by stating the following python Article.objects.prefetch_related("tags") to suppress the SQL issued by ManyT

item.title: Handling Angular forms in Type safe
item.description: You can use @ngneat/reactive-forms to write forms in type safe. --- normal Angular form ts import { FormBuilder } from '@angular/forms'; construc

item.title: Automatic generation of Django Admin
item.description: I forgot to register admin and it was a hassle, so I'm leaving this as a note. Useful timing - I don't want to put too much effort into Django Admin, but I want at least some functionality - I forget to admin.site.register when adding a model and I want to do something about it.

item.title: Django 4.0 has been released and I'll try it out as I see fit.
item.description: [release notes] Dependent libraries - Django 3.2 asgiref==3.4.1 pytz==2021.3 sqlparse=0.4.2 - Django4.0 asgiref==3.4.1 backports.zo

item.title: Convert Markdown to HTML/add css
item.description: markdown can be converted to HTML by using the following library. [Python-Markdown] install bash > pip install markdown Conversion to HTML bash >>> markdow

item.title: Django shortcuts summary
item.description: [django shortcuts] render py def render(request, template_name, context=None, content_type=None, status=None, using=None): """

item.title: Stories about getting stuck with Google Adsense, site structure, etc.
item.description: The composition of this site is in the form of Name.com -> Route 53 -> AWS ALB - > AWS EC2. At the time of implementation, it was Name.com -> AWS ALB - > AWS EC2, but due to the specification of ALB & registering to adsense
